src_text: Leano la Phaloso go Kgwebo ya Tirelophofo tsa Aforika Borwa (SAA)Kabinete e amogetse pegelo ya tswelopele ka ga tsamaiso phaloso go kgwebo ya SAA go tswa go IMC ka ga SAA, e e eteletsweng pele ke Tona ya Dikgwebo tsa Set haba, Rre Pravin GordaKabinete e dumela gore tlhopo e e namatsang go tswa go baadimisi go wetsa tsamaiso ya phaloso go kgwebo e santse e le itlhophelo e e maleba ebile e le bonako, go khamphani ya puso go fetola merero ya yona eo e tsenyeletsang kgwebo ya yona, sekoloto sa yona le maikarabelo a mangw Kabinete e dumela gore tirelophofo e e fetotsweng e tla latela lenaneo le le fetogileng jaaka tlhokagalo ya dit hono go tsweledisa bakgweetsi ba difofane ba bathobantsho morago ga dingwaga di le 26 mo temokerasing ya ron
trg_text: South African Airways (SAA) Business Rescue PlanCabinet received a progress report on the SAA business rescue process from the IMC on the SAA, chaired by the Public Enterprises Minister Mr Pravin GordhaCabinet maintains that a positive vote from creditors to finalize the business rescue process is still the most viable and expeditious option, for the national carrier to restructure its affairs which include its business, its debt and other liabilitie Cabinet believes a restructured airline will pursue the transformational agenda such as the lack of opportunities for the advancement of black pilots after 26 years into our democrac

src_text: E tshegetsa tshitsinyo ya tirelophofo e nt hwa le maiteko a a akaretsang go batlana le matlole go tswa go metswedi e e farologaneng, go tsenyeletsa le babeeletsi ba ba ka nnang gon Eno ke yona tsela e le nngwe fela eo go ka yona tirelophofo e nt hwa, e e tswelelang, e e gaisanang e e ka neelanang ka ditirelo tse di gokagantsweng tsa selegae, kgaolo le tsa bodit habat haba2.
trg_text: Eighty-eight of these projects are investment-ready and include industries with proven superior multiplier effects in energy; water; transport; information and communication technology infrastructure; human settlements; agriculture and agro processinThese projects will be funded mainly from either of the three streams

src_text: IkonomiKabinete e amogela tekanyetsokabo e e baakantsweng ya tlaleletso ya 2020/2021 e e tlhagisitsweng ke Tona ya Matlotlo, Rre Tito Mboweni ka Laboraro, 24 Seetebosigo 2020.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomes the 2020/21 supplementary adjustments budget delivered by Finance Minister Tito Mboweni on Wednesday, 24 June 2020.

src_text: Seno se bakilwe ke leroborobo la Bolwetse jwa Mogare wa Corona (COVID-19) le dipoelo tsa go wela tlase ga ikonom Tekanyetsokabo ya Tlaleletso e tlhagisa tselammapa go fokotsa sekoloto ka go tokafatsa mekgwa ya go reka le go tlhama motheo wa tsosoloso ya ikonomKabinete e na le tsholofelo ya gore maitlamo a a itsisitsweng ke Tona Mboweni a tla tsepamisa ikonomi ya rona go nna mo tseleng e e popota le go tswelela, bogolosegolo fa mongwe le mongwe a ikamaganya le puso mo go a tsenyeng titrisong Tsa se weng ka ga COVID-19 Kabinete e amogetse pegelo ya tswelopele go tswa go Lekgotla la Naga le le Jarileng Maikarabelo a Mogare wa Coron Jaaka karolo ya tsibogelo go Maemo 3 a kgonagalo e kgolo ya kotsi ya letsholo la taolo ya motsamao wa batho la boset haba, go tlhagisitswe diphetolo go melao go ya ka melawana ya Molao wa Taolo ya Matlhotlhapelo, 2002 (Molao 57 wa 2002).
trg_text: This was necessitated by the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) pandemic and the resultant economic downtur The Supplementary Budget sets out a roadmap to stabilize debt by improving our spending patterns and creating a foundation for economic revivaCabinet is optimistic that the commitments announced by Minister Mboweni will put our economy firmly on a solid and sustainable path, particularly if everyone joins government in implementing them

src_text: Le fa Cabinete e itumelela tiro e e tswileng diatla e e tsweletseng go dirwa go tshola selekanyo magareng ga go tsweledisa matshelo le go a boloka, e atlenegisitse go tsenngwa mo kaseteng ga diphetolo tse di amanang le go bulwa ga direset hurente, dihotele le dikhasin.

src_text: Kabinete e boeletsa piletso go botlhe go dira mmogo go emisa go anama ga ditshwaetsego mo baaging ba rona ka go sala morago ditsamaiso tsa boitekanelo tse di jaaka go tlhapa diatla, sekgala go kamano ya loago le go rwala sesirasefatlhego fa ba le mo mafelong a botlhe Tirisodikgoka e e Ikaegileng ka Bong (GBV) Kabinete e tshwentswe ke go tlhagelela ga palo e e kwa godimo ya dikgetse tsa GBV go ralalal nag Go latela dipolao tsa basadi le bana tse di sa tswang go tlhagelela, e ipileditse go batho botlhe mo Aforika Borwa
trg_text: Update on COVID-19Cabinet received a progress report from the National Coronavirus Command Counci As part of responding to the enhanced risk adjusted Level 3 of the national lockdown, amendments to the regulations in terms of the Disaster Management Act, 2002 (Act 57 of 2002) were presenteWhilst Cabinet appreciated the extensive work still being done to maintain a balance between sustaining livelihoods and saving lives, it approved the gazetting of the amendments relating to the opening of restaurants, hotels and casinoCabinet reiterates the call to all of us to work together to stop the spread of infections within our communities by observing the health protocols such as regularly washing hands, social distancing and wearing a mask when in public Gender-Based Violence (GBV)Cabinet is extremely concerned about the spike in GBV cases across the countr Following the recent spate of murders of women and children, it has called on all people in South Africa to unite and work together to stop this carnag Cabinet commends law-enforcement agencies for their swift action in arresting some of the suspects and has urged the agencies to continue working tirelessly to arrest all those involved in these gruesome murderCabinet is unwavering in its commitment to fully implement a range of interventions developed from the National Strategic Plan on GBV and Femicid The Inter-Ministerial Committee chaired by Minister in The Presidency for Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities, Ms Maite Nkoana-Mashabane, continues to drive the multidisciplinary government intervention However, the most effective intervention requires all South Africans to play their part in ending the culture of violence against the most vulnerable members of society Sustainable Infrastructure Development Symposium of South Africa (SIDSSA)Cabinet welcomes the inaugural SIDSSA held virtually this week, under the theme:

src_text: Kabinete e tsepame mo maitlamong a yona a go tsenya tirisong ka botlalo metseletsele ya ditsenogare tse di tlhagisitsweng ke Leanotogamaano la Boset haba ka ga GBV le Dipolao tsa Basad Komiti ya Ditona e e eteletsweng pele ke Tona Mo Lefapheng la Moporesidente la Basadi, Ba wa le Digole, Moh Maite Nkoana-Mashabane, le tswelela go kgwetsa ditsenogare tsa mekgwamentsi tsa pus Le fa go le jalo, tsenogare e e nonofileng go gaisa e batla Maaforikaborwa otlhe go tshameka karolo ya bona mo go fediseng setlwaedi sa tirisodikgoka ya maloko a a bokoa a set hab 5.

src_text: Simphosiamo ya Tlhabololo go Tswelopele ya Mafaratlhatlha
mo Aforka Borwa (SIDSSA)Kabinete e amogela pulo ya SIDSSA e e neng e tshwerwe ka go dirisa mafaratlhatlha a thekenoloji ya tlhaeletsano mo bekeng eno, ka fa tlase ga setlhogo:
trg_text: Ms Refilwe Moletsane; an Ms Nolwandile Mgoqi-MbalEnquiries: Ms Phumla Williams

src_text: Go beeletsa go mafaratlhatlha go arolelana khumo: jaanong, go latela le go fet
trg_text: Investing in infrastructure for shared prosperity: now, next and beyond .

src_text: SIDSSA ke polatefomo e e tlisang mmogo batshameka karolo mo sebakeng sa peeletso go mafaratlhatlha, bao ba nang le phisego ka ga maikaelelomagolo a go itlhaganedisa leano pusetso la ikonomi e e eteletsweng pele ke mafatlhatlh Ditsenogare tsa mafaratlhatlha e nna e ntse e le setshegetsi go leano la pusetso la ikonomi ya Aforika BorwKa go dirisa tsamaiso eno, palogotlhe ya diporojeke di le 276 e setse e tlhatlhobilw Tseno di dira diporojeke tse di tlhotlheletsang peeletso go mafaratlhatlha ka seabe se golang mo go tlhameng dit hono tsa ditiro le go tsosolosa ikonom Di le somearobedi le borobedi tsa diporojeke tseno di siametse peeletso mme di tsenyeletsa madirelo a a itshupileng go nna le seabe se se kwa godimo sa kgolo mo go tsa eneji; metsi; dipalangwa; mafaratlhatlha a thekenoloji ya tshedimosetso le tlhaeletsano; temothuo le thekenoloji ya temothu Diporojeke tseno di tla bona matlole go tswa go nngwe ya metswedi e meraro- kgwebo,
